poem:
**Reel Apology**

In reels of silence, a film unspooled,  
shadows cast on unlit screens,  
where complaint whispered in muted tones,  
drowned in the flicker of forgotten frames.  
An apology flickers, a lone light beam,  
an empty room hears voices rise—  
projected dreams, justice delayed,  
in this cinema of greyed-out skies.
